Token.Abstract: TMX "Object" - either a rectangle, open polygon (polyline) or closed polygon. Common object base class. Use the concrete subclasses KTTilemapPolyObject, KTTilemapRectangleObject or KTTilemapTileObject if you need access to each object type's specific properties.
Reference to the object layer for quick access to the object's layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The object layer the object is on.

Token.Abstract: Name of the object. TILED-EDITABLE
Name of the object. TILED-EDITABLE
Name of the object. TILED-EDITABLE

The type of object assigned by the user. The type is editable in Tiled from an object's properties dialog. The Types list in Tiled is prefilled with the Object Types added in the Tiled Preferences dialog. You can also import & export Object Types from there. Normally the type is used to identify an object defined in the objectTypes.lua config file. TILED-EDITABLE

The type of object assigned by the user. The type is editable in Tiled from an object's properties dialog. The Types list in Tiled is prefilled with the Object Types added in the Tiled Preferences dialog. You can also import & export Object Types from there. Normally the type is used to identify an object defined in the objectTypes.lua config file. TILED-EDITABLE

The type of object assigned by the user. The type is editable in Tiled from an object's properties dialog. The Types list in Tiled is prefilled with the Object Types added in the Tiled Preferences dialog. You can also import & export Object Types from there. Normally the type is used to identify an object defined in the objectTypes.lua config file. TILED-EDITABLE

The object's properties.
The rotation of the object (in Euler coordinates, radians).
The rotation of the object (in Euler coordinates, radians).
The rotation of the object (in Euler coordinates, radians).
The position of the object (in tile coordinates). For polygons and polylines this refers to the first point of the polygon/polyline.
The position of the object (in tile coordinates). For polygons and polylines this refers to the first point of the polygon/polyline.
The position of the object (in tile coordinates). For polygons and polylines this refers to the first point of the polygon/polyline.
The size of the object (in points). For poly objects the size is the bounding box of the polygon/polyline.
The size of the object (in points). For poly objects the size is the bounding box of the polygon/polyline.
The size of the object (in points). For poly objects the size is the bounding box of the polygon/polyline.
The type of the object, it can be either a rectangle, closed polygon, polyline or a tile. Useful for casting to the proper class without having to query isKindOfClass. DO NOT CHANGE THIS PROPERTY!

NO if the object is visible, YES if it is not visible.
